replies.body:
I don't see a point in religion as most religions are just a rehash of each other (Paganism, Judaism, Christianity, Islam, etc.). As a Deist, each of these monotheist religions are just imitations of one true god with many faces. Thus, you could say that there are many gods, and therefore the original belief of Paganism is the most accurate one of all.

David Cameron was a far better prime minister than people give him credit for.

Star Wars the Force Awakens was a disappointing film which was essentially a remake of A New Hope.

P.S: Because I know someone is going to say it, Deism is not a religion. It's more akin to a theological perspective.

replies.body: I believe that individuality as we currently experience it should be combined into an undying collective consciousness that encompasses the epitome of human experience, ability, and potential to grow. I'm pro hive mind/borg.
replies.body_tagged: I believe that individuality as we currently experience it should be combined into an undying collective consciousness that encompasses the epitome of human experience, ability, and potential to grow. I'm pro hive mind/borg.

replies.body:
The inordinate majority of music produced nowadays (particularly the mainstream tracks that gain the most popularity) is overly simplistic and monotonous, devoid of harmonic and melodic cohesion and flair, and takes little to no creativity, originality, or talent to compose yet is disproportionately admired and praised. A shame that so many people can be impressed by garbage.

John Green is a prosaic author whose writing is second-rate and lacks complexity, elegance, and a natural flow or cadence, appealing mostly to naive teenage girls who don't know any better.
